DOC.detailed_description: Guided Proctor 's conceptual model implementation research , propose study multi-site , cluster randomize trial compare two principal strategy SBIRT delivery within adolescent medicine . In Generalist Strategy , primary care provider delivers brief intervention ( BI ) substance misuse . In Specialist Strategy , BIs deliver behavioral health counselor . The 7 study site , primary care clinic operate large , urban Federally Qualified Health Center Baltimore , randomly assign implement SBIRT adolescent use either Generalist Specialist strategy . Staff site train assigned implementation strategy , quarterly booster training provide implementation period . Implementation outcomes , include : penetration , costs/cost-effectiveness , acceptability , timeliness , fidelity/adherence , patient satisfaction assess 18-month-long implementation period use complementary combination administrative service encounter data , provider patient survey , qualitative interview . At end active implementation period , train technical support activity cease 12 month order measure relative sustainability . The study also examine effectiveness integrate HIV risk screen within SBIRT model .
